page.title: 10TRAINING CENTRE-HARMER GREEN
page.content: In Harmer Green there is a{TRAINING {CENTRE}which trains people to work in{Fine Fare}food stores.It was built in 1900 for an American who lived there for only one year. There used to be 5 bedrooms but it is now partitioned into 23 bedrooms and has 4 bathrooms and 4 shower rooms. In 1979 there was a new lecture hall built for conferences for 150 people, it was a Swedish design.The down stairs became 3 training rooms,a dining room and a kitchen.A long time ago it was the site of a{Monastery. Barnes Wood covers 19 acres of woodland. In 1901 it was taken over by Lady Acland and Sir William Acland.
